Fix the unbound resolver conf.d filenames

The unbound conf.d templates were named unbound.conf.* instead of
unbound.yml.*

commit_message:
Get rid of nomulticell flag in upgrade script

It was removed in favor of CELLSV2_SETUP variable, that gets set
in ironic settings.

Change-Id: I0c2a5cbb3ec235c883e3fea2fa471e72b7a2638a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-26 14:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/connectors/fibre_channel.py'], 'message': 'FC connector logs number of attempts incorrectly

"tries" is never incremented, but is logged.

Just use self.tries instead of "tries" and "self.tries".

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
FC connector logs number of attempts incorrectly

"tries" is never incremented, but is logged.

Just use self.tries instead of "tries" and "self.tries".

Closes-Bug: #1706648

Change-Id: Ib3e7c2e6a918912fda09419e89e138d96ed41fc2

commit_message:
Ceilometer Samples Context should wait until samples are processed

- Ceilometer doesn't process data imediatelly so it makes sense
  to wait until data is processed

- Use UUID for resource ids

- Reduce amount of resources that are created in CI for get_stas scenario

Change-Id: I8b9da5aa31be705a60aeada2be86eda23c334448

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-26 08:35:08.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3'], 'message': 'Default false to Q_ASSIGN_GATEWAY_TO_PUBLIC_BRIDGE

It does not make sense to assign the gateway IP of the public subnet to

commit_message:
Default false to Q_ASSIGN_GATEWAY_TO_PUBLIC_BRIDGE

It does not make sense to assign the gateway IP of the public subnet to
the public bridge interface if Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC is used.

Change-Id: I0169b98bea2f96d0cf5bb2ec64dc6b2481e51e9d

commit_message:
Add documentation for job pagination feature

1. What is the problem
Job pagination list operation supports pagination now, the
implementation patch is here [1]. We need to add documentation
for it.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Add documentation for pagination feature of the job list
operation.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
None.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/480326

Change-Id: I6c8e007b6a7781b4102be4504e8f315147b33bfe

subject: Add debug log to indicate when external lock is taken
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-26 14:54:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Add debug log to indicate when external lock is taken

In a case when a number of threads are concurrently accessing a
resource that has a external lock there is no indication when
one of the threads has taken the external lock.

This patch adds in a debug log to try and add some clarity.

Change-Id: Ibd7cfd3b39370b1a54f2ab50c75c6b92a876ae1a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add debug log to indicate when external lock is taken

In a case when a number of threads are concurrently accessing a
resource that has a external lock there is no indication when
one of the threads has taken the external lock.

This patch adds in a debug log to try and add some clarity.

Change-Id: Ibd7cfd3b39370b1a54f2ab50c75c6b92a876ae1a

commit_message:
Don't use multicell setup for ironic & increase timeout

The reschedule, that happens in multinode jobs quite often, does not
work with multicell setup. Don't use multicell setup for our Ironic
jobs.

Increase the http timeout for clients in order to work around neutron
issue.

Change-Id: I2bbdac5cd431e72517cb1c72bb925660ec8e868b

subject: Remove nova_linuxnet_interface_driver option
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 16:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove nova_linuxnet_interface_driver option

This option is strictly a nova-net option. nova-api previously still
read this option for some nova-net related code and actually added an
iptables rule to allow metadata traffic. Yuck.

Related bug fixes this issue in nova and makes this option dead weight.

Change-Id: I717658c65b30e2dda58f271aa06ffc9db01bde4a
Related-Bug: #1687187
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove nova_linuxnet_interface_driver option

This option is strictly a nova-net option. nova-api previously still
read this option for some nova-net related code and actually added an
iptables rule to allow metadata traffic. Yuck.

Related bug fixes this issue in nova and makes this option dead weight.

Change-Id: I717658c65b30e2dda58f271aa06ffc9db01bde4a
Related-Bug: #1687187

subject: Refactoring test_pod_cli.py
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-29 02:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['tricircleclient/tests/unit/utils.py', 'tricircleclient/tests/unit/v1/test_pod_cli.py', 'tricircleclient/tests/unit/v1/test_pods_cli.py'], 'message': 'Refactoring test_pod_cli.py

1. What is the problem?
The methods are sharing common functionality which make difficult to
avoid duplication.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Refactoring these common functionality.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?

Refactoring test_pod_cli.py

1. What is the problem?
The methods are sharing common functionality which make difficult to
avoid duplication.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Refactoring these common functionality.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
None

commit_message:
Improve logic for volume snapshots tab

This makes the logic around retrieving volume data in the volume
snapshot page slightly safer. Previously, if the snapshots loaded but
volume didn't a NameError could occur, and the error message would have
been incorrect. This patch fixes both of those issues.

Change-Id: I53df72005b343a9836ed96af045a1f0eb0b3c31d
Related-Bug: 1323644

subject: Create image fails if 'enable_image_import' is set
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 11:04:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Create image fails if 'enable_image_import' is set

If user sets 'enable_image_import' to True in glance configuration
file then image creation fails with;
TypeError: 'ImageProxy' object is not callable

The reason is if 'enable_image_import' is True then additional header
is added in the response which was not in proper format. Expected
format is ("header", "value") whereas it was given as
"header: value". Corrected the same to resolve the issue.Create image fails if
'enable_image_import' is set

If user sets 'enable_image_import' to True in glance configuration

TypeError: 'ImageProxy' object is not callable

The reason is if 'enable_image_import' is True then additional header
is added in the response which was not in proper format. Expected
format is ("header", "value") whereas it was given as

Change-Id: Ib762c35d5b53896385cdf5f385ce724c93fc9074
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-28 12:26:13.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py'], 'message': 'Create image fails if 'enable_image_import' is set

commit_message:
Create image fails if 'enable_image_import' is set

If user sets 'enable_image_import' to True in glance configuration
file then image creation fails with;
TypeError: 'ImageProxy' object is not callable

The reason is if 'enable_image_import' is True then additional header
is added in the response which was not in proper format. Expected
format is ("header", "value") whereas it was given as
"header: value". Corrected the same to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Ib762c35d5b53896385cdf5f385ce724c93fc9074

commit_message:
Refactoring test_pod_cli.py

1. What is the problem?
The methods are sharing common functionality which make difficult to
avoid duplication.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Refactoring these common functionality.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
None

Change-Id: I379abedc0f7ab895d7b4e563354755c64a920f06

commit_message:
Add delete_container to periodic task

- The container with status DELETED is not removed automatically.
This patch will add delete_container method to remove it
in periodic task.

- Increase the severity of log level to Info.

- Support filter container with status, task_state.

- Change param handlers to endpoints for consistent.

Change-Id: I0c703fc2c69c9a582e7cb3b34e8aa08c098e37e4
Depends-On: Ic6d35274a49648bde5e0e7486453a6d1a13f6f2e
Related-Bug: #1644901
Closes-Bug: #1701984

commit_message:
Deprecate oslo.messaging rpc_backend option parameter

Oslo.messaging uses the transport_url to represent the rpc and
notification messaging driver to use and its full configuration. The
rpc_backend configuration option is deprecated for removal and
should not gate oslo.messaging driver configuration options.

This patch:
* deprecate rpc_backend
* remove conditional check
* add release note

Change-Id: I00948197fef80ce54a9a382d251b54e39053f7a7

commit_message:
[DOCS] Use upstream etcd environment definition

The etcd environment definition is included in the integrated repo
now, so instead of defining an env.d definition, we only need to add
hosts to the existing env.d skeleton provided under 'etcd_hosts'.

Change-Id: I3f24557d0a48d0127fd406d30fc8c602470a44d2
Depends-On: Id395ae972ea821b36f3b4ae09f4c72280256e676

commit_message:
add acng to the host system and preseeds

This change ensures that the VMs and host systems cache apt packges
locally which will speed up the boot and deployment process.

Change-Id: I234e338b9f1b9f11ff1e81ede8c5717e033fdad8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

add lbaasv2 to NeutronServicePlugins in octavia containers

without lbaasv2 neutron will not be able to load the plugin
and communicate with octavia.

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

Due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, only python3.5 is
available(Python3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka). So, there is no
need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I07bf6c3299a2e509a2d30342922459dc79c8f281

commit_message:
Allow specifying empty amp_boot_network_list

Some nova deployments automatically select their networks on boot.
We can allow for this by assuming there will be some default network if
the amp_boot_network_list is empty.

Change-Id: I38ccfb45afb93795860c12efaf5a32f9bd1689fd
(cherry picked from commit 4fcbb833d50a083e59515a5ebd8fe6a75ade675e)

commit_message:
Allow specifying empty amp_boot_network_list

Some nova deployments automatically select their networks on boot.
We can allow for this by assuming there will be some default network if
the amp_boot_network_list is empty.

Change-Id: I38ccfb45afb93795860c12efaf5a32f9bd1689fd
(cherry picked from commit 4fcbb833d50a083e59515a5ebd8fe6a75ade675e)

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Similar to CentOS,
we need to modify the libvirt sysconfig file to enable/disable the
TCP/IP listening option. Moreover, we also update the  zypper cache
before package installation.

Change-Id: I7b2a39eb38b5bee08c90f5188c53e0e5cf3d7e2e

commit_message:
Revert "Default neutron's dns_domain to undercloud's domain"

Per my comment on the original change, I have concerns about
this change to the default behavior of the undercloud.  I
haven't gotten a response to my comment there (probably because
the patch is already merged), so I'm proposing that we revert
it until there is a clear path forward for making the defaults
in the overcloud templates work sanely with this.

This reverts commit 437b116e461396da1a7e94f1c6afde36cb380dae.

Change-Id: Id8e8cfd3d82fad6e31a4224a7897e932f0690ddb

commit_message:
Fixup EPEL comments

when attempeting certain calls to kolla --template-only
jinja2 would fail with

jinja2.exceptions.TemplateSyntaxError: unexpected char u'#' at 2123

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13562222/jinja2-inline-comments
http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.9/templates/#comments

Related to: I0aac6c48371b66fd1866fee61a9ee7d83d4fc56d

Change-Id: I941f1b1d7214c80d562a17fa77387a23d7ce7064

subject: Fix --noop being ignored for dhclient execution
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-21 23:01:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix --noop being ignored for dhclient execution

The stop_dhclient_execution() method calls netconfig.execute
directly from the object, instead of from the instance of
the object. This has the effect that when execute is called,
noop is always set false, even if os-net-config was called
with --noop. This results in a failure or network outage.

This change checks the value of self.noop from within the
provider.apply() method before calling the
stop_dhclient_execution method.

Change-Id: Ie2cc4519d7028dceb3a14bd7711839834db0ebdf
Closes-bug: 1699590

commit_message:
Fix --noop being ignored for dhclient execution

The stop_dhclient_execution() method calls netconfig.execute
directly from the object, instead of from the instance of
the object. This has the effect that when execute is called,
noop is always set false, even if os-net-config was called
with --noop. This results in a failure or network outage.

This change checks the value of self.noop from within the
provider.apply() method before calling the
stop_dhclient_execution method.

Change-Id: Ie2cc4519d7028dceb3a14bd7711839834db0ebdf
Closes-bug: 1699590

commit_message:
turn on debugging for collect logs script by default

The collect logs script is already only displayed when there
is a problem. We should always run w/ verbose debug to assist
in finding problems.

Change-Id: I63767ac92e8ca5a48dff22f61d24dced6829e880

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated 'message' attribute in Exception

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated and removed
from Python3.
For more details, please check:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: I0d8441745029e18aa040811a5dc6725f465aa797

commit_message:
Use tox_install.sh to install dependencies

Now that os-service-types exists in the requirements repository, we need
to take special care to unconstrain it when we run tests on it. That is
what the tox_install.sh script does (copied from keystoneauth in this
case). If we don't do this, tox will be unable to install test
dependencies in CI[1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/85/488085/4/check/gate-os-service-types-docs-ubuntu-xenial/6cb3162/console.html

Change-Id: I2726075d6f9eec33094753cda558275e433b6ca4

commit_message:
Removing LBaaS v1 API reference

LBaaS v1 was last included in the mitaka release which is now EOL.
This patch removes the API reference section for the LBaaS v1 API.

Change-Id: Ic2c042671fe625c63a524038f6d629b8e223abb1

commit_message:
create stable/pike branches for all of our libraries

Except barbicanclient which is working on a critical fix and
neutronclient which had a late release request that we haven't
resolved.

Change-Id: Ib4866823c7f3477e09999106086a882d8f650b64
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Clean up python-barbicanclient imports

In python-barbicanclient release 4.5.0, a backwards incompatible
change was made to move all the objects into a v1 directory.

This changes the unit tests to not use the barbicanclient objects
directly.

Change-Id: Ib4b407f3b7dc11adc4e2f53231853bb7a54c4167

commit_message:
Disable unnecessary CentOS repos

The OpenStack CI image for CentOS has LOTS of repositories enabled
and downloading all of that metadata may be slowing CentOS jobs
down. This patch disables all CentOS repositories in the gate
except for base, epel, and updates.

Individual playbooks may enable other repositories, like RDO/MariaDB,
later on in the deployment.

Change-Id: I5a94aa5d46f65e0c52f90970b4c095e431ec73a8

commit_message:
Add netlink-lib to manage conntrack entries

When the security group is updated, the conntrack entries will be deleted
by conntrack-tools with each rule associated with each SG rule.

In large scale system, updating so much rules will call a large number
of subprocesses to implement the "conntrack -D" commands. That will
consume the system resource and time.

This netlink-lib will be used by netlink conntrack driver to improve
conntrack management performance.

Original solution and performance from neutron-fwaas [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438445/

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-19 19:46:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py'], 'message': "WIP: Remove global lock from _IntegratedTestBase

We see random weird TimeoutExceptions when the
ResourceTracker.update_available_resource task runs,
which holds a compute lock.

There shouldn't be a reason that we need to have a
global file lock on 90% of our functional tests,
so this removes the global test lock to see if it
makes a difference. Any tests that actually need
a global lock should be setting that flag specifically.

Change-Id: Ifef2a265bd6e8f6ffcf977632e9df306f69c9b8e
Related-Bug: #1704588
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP: Remove global lock from _IntegratedTestBase

We see random weird TimeoutExceptions when the
ResourceTracker.update_available_resource task runs,
which holds a compute lock.

There shouldn't be a reason that we need to have a
global file lock on 90% of our functional tests,
so this removes the global test lock to see if it
makes a difference. Any tests that actually need
a global lock should be setting that flag specifically.

Change-Id: Ifef2a265bd6e8f6ffcf977632e9df306f69c9b8e
Related-Bug: #1704588

commit_message:
Use sudo with rsync for logs

Some logs in /var/log were skipped, such as yum.log, because rsync
is not being run as root. This patch uses sudo to rsync logs and
this should give us more of the logs we're looking for.

The yum.log will be very helpful to diagnose CentOS gate shenanigans.

Change-Id: I6abc69de66e15f336c22d216216be530165c5887
(cherry picked from commit a5fa549f299a010a8a30c6e41e83ad23c4c45b78)

commit_message:
Use sudo with rsync for logs

Some logs in /var/log were skipped, such as yum.log, because rsync
is not being run as root. This patch uses sudo to rsync logs and
this should give us more of the logs we're looking for.

The yum.log will be very helpful to diagnose CentOS gate shenanigans.

Change-Id: I6abc69de66e15f336c22d216216be530165c5887
(cherry picked from commit a5fa549f299a010a8a30c6e41e83ad23c4c45b78)

subject: Remove trove_regular_user
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-27 17:45:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove trove_regular_user

Remove the unnecessary trove_regular_user.  The documenation that was
referenced [1] when this was added to the role is intended to configure
Trove for development purposes. The trove_regular_user is not used by the
Trove service and is only being created to give the developer a non-admin
user to use for testing.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/trove/latest/install/manual_install.html

Change-Id: Ic71216c21092a22105ad56ef98e1554dff48f0b0
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-28 14:55:47.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml'], 'message': 'Remove trove_regular_user

Remove the unnecessary trove_regular_user.  The documenation that was
referenced [1] when this was added to the role is intended to configure
Trove for development purposes. The trove_regular_user is not used by the
Trove service and is only being created to give the developer a non-admin
user to use for testing.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/trove/latest/install/manual_install.html

Change-Id: Ic71216c21092a22105ad56ef98e1554dff48f0b0
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove trove_regular_user

Remove the unnecessary trove_regular_user.  The documenation that was
referenced [1] when this was added to the role is intended to configure
Trove for development purposes. The trove_regular_user is not used by the
Trove service and is only being created to give the developer a non-admin
user to use for testing.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/trove/latest/install/manual_install.html

Change-Id: Ic71216c21092a22105ad56ef98e1554dff48f0b0

subject: Switch to enabled version of identity clients
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-07 19:08:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Switch to enabled version of identity clients

Patrole always uses (e.g.) v3 roles client to retrieve
list of roles which is bad if the v3 identity service is not enabled.

Cases like the following:

    self.roles_client = test_obj.os_admin.roles_v3_client

Should be changed to:

    self.roles_client = test_obj.os_admin.roles_v3_client \
                        if CONF.identity_feature_enabled.api_v3 \
                        else test_obj.os_admin.roles_client

This commit switches between the correct identity client
depending on the identity version that is enabled in tempest.conf.
The v3 client is prioritized as identity v3 is current.

This commit also corrects/improves upon some documentation errata.

Change-Id: I9a12196f11473ac4e045ae90c4321219beab7ca6
Closes-Bug: #1702980

commit_message:
Switch to enabled version of identity clients

Patrole always uses (e.g.) v3 roles client to retrieve
list of roles which is bad if the v3 identity service is not enabled.

Cases like the following:

    self.roles_client = test_obj.os_admin.roles_v3_client

Should be changed to:

    self.roles_client = test_obj.os_admin.roles_v3_client \
                        if CONF.identity_feature_enabled.api_v3 \
                        else test_obj.os_admin.roles_client

This commit switches between the correct identity client
depending on the identity version that is enabled in tempest.conf.
The v3 client is prioritized as identity v3 is current.

This commit also corrects/improves upon some documentation errata.

Change-Id: I9a12196f11473ac4e045ae90c4321219beab7ca6
Closes-Bug: #1702980

subject: Don't reload sysctl each time
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 14:18:04.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/openstack_kernel_tuning.yml'], 'message': "Don't reload sysctl each time

If we're setting the sysctl value with `sysctl_set` and writing it
to the conf file with `state`, there's no need to force a reload of
the sysctl.conf file. By the time each item in the loop finishes,
the sysctl value is set in the running system and in the conf file
already.

This should speed up the task.

Change-Id: Id5b4f0629f0c00c58469b03e0760891923e43fbe
(cherry picked from commit 7e585fd0aeef84232df78eb7c8f04bedea80834b)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't reload sysctl each time

If we're setting the sysctl value with `sysctl_set` and writing it
to the conf file with `state`, there's no need to force a reload of
the sysctl.conf file. By the time each item in the loop finishes,
the sysctl value is set in the running system and in the conf file
already.

This should speed up the task.

subject: Don't reload sysctl each time
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 14:17:58.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/openstack_kernel_tuning.yml'], 'message': "Don't reload sysctl each time

If we're setting the sysctl value with `sysctl_set` and writing it
to the conf file with `state`, there's no need to force a reload of
the sysctl.conf file. By the time each item in the loop finishes,
the sysctl value is set in the running system and in the conf file
already.

This should speed up the task.

Change-Id: Id5b4f0629f0c00c58469b03e0760891923e43fbe
(cherry picked from commit 7e585fd0aeef84232df78eb7c8f04bedea80834b)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't reload sysctl each time

If we're setting the sysctl value with `sysctl_set` and writing it
to the conf file with `state`, there's no need to force a reload of
the sysctl.conf file. By the time each item in the loop finishes,
the sysctl value is set in the running system and in the conf file
already.

This should speed up the task.

Change-Id: Id5b4f0629f0c00c58469b03e0760891923e43fbe
(cherry picked from commit 7e585fd0aeef84232df78eb7c8f04bedea80834b)

commit_message:
Add S3 jar to Hadoop classpath

As prereq of support for S3 datasource, the hadoop-aws jar needs to be
in the Hadoop classpath. The jar is copied into the proper folder when
possible on the appropriate plugins, and otherwise can be provided from
a download URL by the user.

Additionally, set the correct value of DIB_HDFS_LIB_DIR on the Vanilla
plugin to avoid any unnecessary simlinking.

Partially-Implements: bp sahara-support-s3

Change-Id: I94c5b0055b87f6a4e1382118d0718e588fccfe87

commit_message:
Adds support for editing portgroups

Adds support for editing portgroups from the node-details/configuration
page. Each entry in the portgroups table has an associated
``Edit portgroup`` button that when clicked will launch a modal
dialog that guides the user in making changes.

Unit tests will follow.

Change-Id: I8907800f23cc42c301fc8f077fb00a9a6cb18821

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-12 23:53:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "doc: minor cleanup

* We have a long index in user/index page, as the history page
  has a lot of sections. It loses the readability in general.
  Let's use maxdepth 1 for history in the toctree directive.

* Remove unnecessary vertical line for quote blocks.
  openstackdocstheme shows a vertial line for quote blocks.

commit_message:
doc: minor cleanup

* We have a long index in user/index page, as the history page
  has a lot of sections. It loses the readability in general.
  Let's use maxdepth 1 for history in the toctree directive.

* Remove unnecessary vertical line for quote blocks.
  openstackdocstheme shows a vertial line for quote blocks.
  If we have unnecessary leading spaces, the vertical line are shown.
  This cleans up such spaces in user/sphinxext.rst.

Change-Id: I913d23cc6148d37d28c27c4f3a40b5a6225dac76

commit_message:
Add etcd environment definition

Instead of requiring the user to define an env.d override to deploy
etcd when Calico is used, we can provide a default etcd environment
definition that will only deploy etcd containers if 'etcd_hosts'
are defined in the openstack_user_config.

There is no upgrade impact because users who already use calico
will have an out of tree environment defintion in
/etc/openstack_deploy/env.d which overrides the in-tree version.

Change-Id: Id395ae972ea821b36f3b4ae09f4c72280256e676

commit_message:
Remove EPEL and it's dependencies with Kolla overrides (take two)

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/483473/ we tentatively removed EPEL
and what we thought was it's only dependency but it turns out there is
much more. With this set of overrides, we are able to build all containers
successfully.

Change-Id: I0aac6c48371b66fd1866fee61a9ee7d83d4fc56d

Update pod affinity to allow customisation

This PS updates the pod affinity function to allow customisation by
operators at the point of deployment.

commit_message:
Fixes devstack ldap plugin

When the ldap service is enable on local.conf devstack ldap
plugin starts slapd service using its default config on Ubuntu
and installs ldap-utils package.
Enables domain specific drivers on Keystone and creates LDAP
domain 'Users' with a demo user.

Change-Id: I8d7aa260b01f675e4ed201ef93bfd66474f4b228

subject: Lower python-barbicanclient u-c to 4.4.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 12:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Lower python-barbicanclient u-c to 4.4.0

There are issues with python-barbicanclient 4.5.0 that
caused it to be reverted from u-c with patch
I14316df5598d419751cd7f1c1f4af8fd590c4556 but then
another update I772c591eed6290c61e170e9027532f7f8c182530
appears to have accidentally picked up the original
4.5.0 change and moved it back up.

This patch lowers the u-c until the issues with 4.5.0
can be worked out.

Change-Id: Ieb79c2049634293747a24a910d29714e6fd44b2f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Lower python-barbicanclient u-c to 4.4.0

There are issues with python-barbicanclient 4.5.0 that
caused it to be reverted from u-c with patch
I14316df5598d419751cd7f1c1f4af8fd590c4556 but then
another update I772c591eed6290c61e170e9027532f7f8c182530
appears to have accidentally picked up the original
4.5.0 change and moved it back up.

This patch lowers the u-c until the issues with 4.5.0
can be worked out.

Change-Id: Ieb79c2049634293747a24a910d29714e6fd44b2f

commit_message:
Fixing read before prompt bug

Due to Python buffering sys.stdin and sys.stdout, the read can be shown
before text prompt.

Change-Id: I86d9ec62f7791da276585ce74a48162315effa7b
Signed-off-by: Joe Borg <joe@josephb.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-02 09:15:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Macvtap: Check for no original port in is_live_migration

Change 6865f4d9f22d5daa2f07ff9651c2280aed489c8c mistakenly
assumed that None would not be present for the 'original'
property on a PortContext. However, this is the default value
for the original field in PortContext, which is what is used
in the construction as part of the _create_port_db process
in ML2.

This resulted in binding failures for the macvtap mech drivers
due to an attribute error in cases like brand new ports.

This patch simply checks for None before trying to determine
if it's a live migration (which it isn't in the case of port creation).

Part of the issue is likely that the FakePortContext in the unit tests
was defaulting to an empty dict which is the not the same behavior as
the real PortContext.

Change-Id: I6659235a70aa4528fd21911c04e651194591e449
Closes-Bug: #1658802
(cherry picked from commit 3dddfa56db69b504408c6894a814a89ea63b05f0)
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-06-15 19:42:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/test_mech_macvtap.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/mech_macvtap.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/_test_mech_agent.py'], 'message': "Macvtap: Check for no original port in is_live_migration

This resulted in binding failures for the macvtap mech drivers
due to an attribute error in cases like brand new ports.

This patch simply checks for None before trying to determine
if it's a live migration (which it isn't in the case of port creation).

Part of the issue is likely that the FakePortContext in the unit tests
was defaulting to an empty dict which is the not the same behavior as

Change-Id: I6659235a70aa4528fd21911c04e651194591e449
Closes-Bug: #1658802
(cherry picked from commit 3dddfa56db69b504408c6894a814a89ea63b05f0)
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Macvtap: Check for no original port in is_live_migration

Change 6865f4d9f22d5daa2f07ff9651c2280aed489c8c mistakenly
assumed that None would not be present for the 'original'
property on a PortContext. However, this is the default value
for the original field in PortContext, which is what is used
in the construction as part of the _create_port_db process
in ML2.

This resulted in binding failures for the macvtap mech drivers
due to an attribute error in cases like brand new ports.

This patch simply checks for None before trying to determine
if it's a live migration (which it isn't in the case of port creation).

Part of the issue is likely that the FakePortContext in the unit tests
was defaulting to an empty dict which is the not the same behavior as
the real PortContext.

Change-Id: I6659235a70aa4528fd21911c04e651194591e449
Closes-Bug: #1658802
(cherry picked from commit 3dddfa56db69b504408c6894a814a89ea63b05f0)

commit_message:
Remove the deploy vm and use the log node instead

This reduces the resource consumption by removing the deploy node and
using the log node instead. This also ups the ram allocation to the
infra hosts which will improve the deployment experience by ensuring we
don't run out of memory.

Change-Id: Id38ff386669308ac3fd1e539ae37c969f00353b8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Combine our two multi-node-aio processes into one
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-27 06:11:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Combine our two multi-node-aio processes into one

The original mnaio was built using a lot of bash and was tailored
specifically for ubuntu 14.04. The new mnaio was built using a mix of
bash and ansible and was tailored specifically for ubuntu 16.04. This
patch takes the two code bases and combines the best things from each
method and wraps it up into a single code path all written using ansible
playbooks and basic variables.

While underlying system has changed the bash environment variable syntax
for overrides remains the same. This allows users to continue with what
has become their normal work-flow while leveraging the new structure and
capabilities.

High level overview:
  * The general performance of the VMs running within the MNAIO will now
    be a lot better. Before the VMs were built within QCOW2 containers,
    while this was flexible and portable it was slower. The new
    capabilities will use RAW logical volumes and native IO.
  * New repo management starts with preseeds and allows the user to pin
    to specific repositories without having to worry about flipping them
    post build.
  * CPU overhead will be a lot less. The old VM system used an
    un-reasonable number of processors per VM which directly translated
    to sockets. The new system will use cores and a single socket
    allowing for generally better VM performance with a lot less
    overhead and resource contention on the host.
  * Memory consumption has been greatly reduced. Each VM is now
    following the memory restrictions we'd find in the gate, as a MAX.
    Most of the VMs are using 1 - 2 GiB of RAM which should be more than
    enough for our purposes.

Overall the deployment process is simpler and more flexible and will
work on both trusty and xenial out of the box with the hope to bring
centos7 and suse into the fold some time in the future.

Change-Id: Idc8924452c481b08fd3b9362efa32d10d1b8f707

    capabilities will use RAW logical volumes and native IO.
  * New repo management starts with preseeds and allows the user to pin
    to specific repositories without having to worry about flipping them
    post build.
  * CPU overhead will be a lot less. The old VM system used an
    un-reasonable number of processors per VM which directly translated
    to sockets. The new system will use cores and a single socket
    allowing for generally better VM performance with a lot less
    overhead and resource contention on the host.
  * Memory consumption has been greatly reduced. Each VM is now
    following the memory restrictions we'd find in the gate, as a MAX.
    Most of the VMs are using 1 - 2 GiB of RAM which should be more than
    enough for our purposes.

Overall the deployment process is simpler and more flexible and will
work on both trusty and xenial out of the box with the hope to bring
centos7 and suse into the fold some time in the future.

Change-Id: Idc8924452c481b08fd3b9362efa32d10d1b8f707
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Combine our two multi-node-aio processes into one

The original mnaio was built using a lot of bash and was tailored
specifically for ubuntu 14.04. The new mnaio was built using a mix of
bash and ansible and was tailored specifically for ubuntu 16.04. This
patch takes the two code bases and combines the best things from each
method and wraps it up into a single code path all written using ansible
playbooks and basic variables.

While underlying system has changed the bash environment variable syntax
for overrides remains the same. This allows users to continue with what
has become their normal work-flow while leveraging the new structure and
capabilities.

High level overview:
  * The general performance of the VMs running within the MNAIO will now
    be a lot better. Before the VMs were built within QCOW2 containers,
    while this was flexible and portable it was slower. The new
    capabilities will use RAW logical volumes and native IO.
  * New repo management starts with preseeds and allows the user to pin
    to specific repositories without having to worry about flipping them
    post build.
  * CPU overhead will be a lot less. The old VM system used an
    un-reasonable number of processors per VM which directly translated
    to sockets. The new system will use cores and a single socket
    allowing for generally better VM performance with a lot less
    overhead and resource contention on the host.
  * Memory consumption has been greatly reduced. Each VM is now
    following the memory restrictions we'd find in the gate, as a MAX.
    Most of the VMs are using 1 - 2 GiB of RAM which should be more than
    enough for our purposes.

Overall the deployment process is simpler and more flexible and will
work on both trusty and xenial out of the box with the hope to bring
centos7 and suse into the fold some time in the future.

Change-Id: Idc8924452c481b08fd3b9362efa32d10d1b8f707

commit_message:
group_vars: repo_all: Always build cryptography from source

cryptography may bundle openssl in the wheel and that causes symbol
conflicts if a different openssl is provided by the distribution.
As such, it's probably safer to re-build cryptography ourselves just
to be sure that the correct distro libraries are used. This has been
addressed in openstack-ansible-tests/test-vars.yaml
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486580/) to fix the CI tests but the
problem is also present on regular deployments so we set it in the
group_variables for the repo_all group of hosts so it's built from
source in the wheel repository.

Related-Bug: 1705521
Link: https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/3804
Change-Id: I54ba3c1fa48a2f4c633930bc7e8cc65397f86659

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 09:27:50.000000000', 'files': ['docker/docker-puppet.py'], 'message': "Also log docker-puppet.py puppet output to console

Running puppet apply with --logdest syslog results in all the output
being redirected to syslog. You get no error messages. In the case where this fails, the subsequent debug task shows nothing useful
as there was no stdout/stderr.

Also pass --logdest console to docker-puppet's puppet apply so that
we get the output for the debug task.

Related-Bug: #1707030

Change-Id: I67df5eee9916237420ca646a16e188f26c828c0e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Also log docker-puppet.py puppet output to console

Running puppet apply with --logdest syslog results in all the output
being redirected to syslog. You get no error messages. In the case where this fails, the subsequent debug task shows nothing useful
as there was no stdout/stderr.

Also pass --logdest console to docker-puppet's puppet apply so that
we get the output for the debug task.

Related-Bug: #1707030

Change-Id: I67df5eee9916237420ca646a16e188f26c828c0e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Set overcloud_domain_name using overcloud_cloud_domain

the overcloud_cloud_domain variable that we already use for the

commit_message:
Added test_boot_volume_network_connectivity scenario test

* This scenario test will test the floating ip connectivity for
  an instance booted from cinder volume
* Below is the list of operation it does:
 - Create in Cinder some bootable volume importing a Glance image
 - Create keypair and security group
 - Boot an instance from the bootable volume
 - Attach floating IP to it and check network connectivity
 - Delete the instance.

Change-Id: Ia82d76d2ec45ba4967bc11e7524993d2bfd652c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-27 18:57:48.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/tripleo_selinux_spec.rb', 'manifests/profile/base/nova/libvirt.pp', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_nova_libvirt_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix nova and selinux unit tests

The unit tests jobs are failing because of missing pre conditions for
the new shared class introduced by
Ib233689fdcdda391596d01a21f77bd8e1672ae04.  Additionally this change
moved some classes around so that the tests are now failing due to
duplicate class declarations for nova::compute::libvirt::services. This

the include that exists in tripleo::profile::base::nova::libvirt.

The selinux test was also failing due to a type issue with the fact

Closes-Bug: #1707034

commit_message:
Fix nova and selinux unit tests

The unit tests jobs are failing because of missing pre conditions for
the new shared class introduced by
Ib233689fdcdda391596d01a21f77bd8e1672ae04.  Additionally this change
moved some classes around so that the tests are now failing due to
duplicate class declarations for nova::compute::libvirt::services. This
change moves the include that pulls in the declaration first prior to
the include that exists in tripleo::profile::base::nova::libvirt.

The selinux test was also failing due to a type issue with the fact
being used (boolean vs string)

Change-Id: I5bd4b61d6008820729d58f7743e7e61955dd6f51
Closes-Bug: #1707034

commit_message:
Fail when no test case selected

When the list based filtering logic was used
and no test was selected at the end.
testr was invoked to run all test.

For example:
ostestr --regex a --black-regex a

Change-Id: I7b580c3954f71dc5fe347b82d6d14004bfdb8f22

commit_message:
Link to latest version

Right now the version drop down links to "Current" which is always the
current version. This is IMHO useless, replace it with a link to
"latest" to link to the most recent version.

Change-Id: Ic221f9a1b10ddee2143d95f69bd56679793c884b

information about the running kernel but also to look for kernel

[{'created': '2017-07-05 14:41:34.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Do not use *_ssh ironic drivers by default

SSH-based power and management driver interfaces and drivers that use
them have been declared as unsupported in ironic before Newton release,
and are aimed to be removed from ironic code in Pike release.

This patch switches default for DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER to pxe_ipmitool,
and removes *_ssh driver from default enabled drivers.

Change-Id: I9b60c9fa24652e9e64e787cd4e5b0152f51e7a28
Depends-On: I74e26943862018b2beecc0b53ba1fb0183a6adf1
Related-Bug: #1570301
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not use *_ssh ironic drivers by default

SSH-based power and management driver interfaces and drivers that use
them have been declared as unsupported in ironic before Newton release,
and are aimed to be removed from ironic code in Pike release.

This patch switches default for DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER to pxe_ipmitool,
and removes *_ssh driver from default enabled drivers.

Change-Id: I9b60c9fa24652e9e64e787cd4e5b0152f51e7a28
Depends-On: I74e26943862018b2beecc0b53ba1fb0183a6adf1
Related-Bug: #1570301

commit_message:
Don't reload sysctl each time

If we're setting the sysctl value with `sysctl_set` and writing it
to the conf file with `state`, there's no need to force a reload of
the sysctl.conf file. By the time each item in the loop finishes,
the sysctl value is set in the running system and in the conf file
already.

This should speed up the task.

Change-Id: Id5b4f0629f0c00c58469b03e0760891923e43fbe

commit_message:
Use sudo with rsync for logs

Some logs in /var/log were skipped, such as yum.log, because rsync
is not being run as root. This patch uses sudo to rsync logs and
this should give us more of the logs we're looking for.

The yum.log will be very helpful to diagnose CentOS gate shenanigans.

Change-Id: I6abc69de66e15f336c22d216216be530165c5887

subject: Fix neutron agent container removal
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 09:08:25.000000000', 'files': ['leap-upgrades/upgrade-utilities/neutron-remove-old-containers.yml'], 'message': "Fix neutron agent container removal

This change fixes the removal of neutron agent containers so that it no
longer relies on the containers existing on the deploy host.

The file `leapfrog_remove_remaining_old_containers` is only created on
the deploy host, when combined with the fact that the original task
couldn't fail, it resulted in the removal of the containers silently
failing on multi-node builds.

This change gets the list of containers from the file on the deploy host
before trying to delete them on all hosts.

Change-Id: Ic95187fd7e7ff93c796ce01f296cb06a16ba72bd
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron agent container removal

This change fixes the removal of neutron agent containers so that it no
longer relies on the containers existing on the deploy host.

The file `leapfrog_remove_remaining_old_containers` is only created on
the deploy host, when combined with the fact that the original task
couldn't fail, it resulted in the removal of the containers silently
failing on multi-node builds.

This change gets the list of containers from the file on the deploy host
before trying to delete them on all hosts.

Change-Id: Ic95187fd7e7ff93c796ce01f296cb06a16ba72bd

commit_message:
Prefilter the list of groups for repo_masters

Filter the list of groups to those beginning with '^repo_servers_'
within the 'with_items' of the 'Prepare group of master repo servers'
task' instead of iterating and skipping each group name within the
inventory.

Change-Id: I814ad0f97badcdab83596e79720685c739f8e010

commit_message:
Add support for OS-Brick force disconnect

OS-Brick disconnect has a force parameter since version 1.15.1 that can
be used to make sure a disconnect call gives more priority to cleaning
up everything than preserving data.

This patch adds support for this new force parameter using it in calls
where we know it's OK to lose data when we encounter an error as long as
we report that we have failed.

Change-Id: Id6a7f4cf264c540473269104daf20f39891b5a1b

Write kernel modules via template

Using lineinfile for writing kernel modules is tedious and usually
takes 10-12 seconds each time. This method takes about 1 second.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-13 07:05:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Networking_odl maintenance tasks(threads) compete with each other

To solve this bug, following two approach has been taken

1) Interval has been increased/decreased by small prime number to
   make sure that two/three/four maintenance task does not meet
   at the same time interval to acquire lock. So if we have 30s
   and 300s and prime number selected are 1 and 3. -, + for the
   tasks therefor they will meet at 29 * 303 = 8787s, which is
   large enough. If they meet at the same time interval then
   second point come to rescue. Primes are taken small so that
   they don't impact the interval by large amonunt. +/- has been
   introduce to reduce the difference between set and actual value.

2) In case two maintenance task has been selected the same or one
   divides the other after step 1 calculation therefore retry has
   has been added. Therefor locking will be attempted 3 times before
   declaring that lock can not be taken.

Change-Id: I82c5815479fd9db72a386097a5e6f615e5668482

commit_message:
Networking_odl maintenance tasks(threads) compete with each other

To solve this bug, following two approach has been taken

1) Interval has been increased/decreased by small prime number to
   make sure that two/three/four maintenance task does not meet
   at the same time interval to acquire lock. So if we have 30s
   and 300s and prime number selected are 1 and 3. -, + for the
   tasks therefor they will meet at 29 * 303 = 8787s, which is
   large enough. If they meet at the same time interval then
   second point come to rescue. Primes are taken small so that
   they don't impact the interval by large amonunt. +/- has been
   introduce to reduce the difference between set and actual value.

2) In case two maintenance task has been selected the same or one
   divides the other after step 1 calculation therefore retry has
   has been added. Therefor locking will be attempted 3 times before
   declaring that lock can not be taken.

This bug is solved in master by following commit id
27d59d019005622aca708905ff72394d5587454d

Fix in master involves db migration scripts therefore we came up
with alternate way of fixing it using this patch.

Change-Id: I82c5815479fd9db72a386097a5e6f615e5668482
Closes-bug: #1701209

commit_message:
Fix notification configuration

Remove the exists_notification_ticks conf setting that was removed from
Trove 2 years ago.

Remove the exists_notification_transformer setting which enables an optional
function which has been broken since Ocata per bug 1700586.

Change-Id: If9fd396d14907d4f88065ac34f671b3370a1ffa7
Related-Bug: #1700586

subject: tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Add missing files to the dnsmasq apparmor profile
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-25 17:49:27.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_install_zypper.yml'], 'message': 'tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Add missing files to the dnsmasq apparmor profile

Commit d77bbf6d0ab6 ("tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Relax apparmor
restrictions for dnsmasq") added some neutron directories to the
dnsmasq apparmor profile in order to allow dnsmasq to work on a
neutron environment. However, it missed /var/lib/neutron so apparmor
still prevents dnsmasq from running. Moreover, we fix the regexp
to allow access to files even on neutron subdirectories just to be
sure.

Fixes: d77bbf6d0ab6 ("tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Relax apparmor restrictions for dnsmasq")
Change-Id: I2f839e473267a25c8fd51a0389510485f126fc7c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Add missing files to the dnsmasq apparmor profile

Commit d77bbf6d0ab6 ("tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Relax apparmor
restrictions for dnsmasq") added some neutron directories to the
dnsmasq apparmor profile in order to allow dnsmasq to work on a
neutron environment. However, it missed /var/lib/neutron so apparmor
still prevents dnsmasq from running. Moreover, we fix the regexp
to allow access to files even on neutron subdirectories just to be
sure.

Fixes: d77bbf6d0ab6 ("tasks: lxc_install_zypper: Relax apparmor restrictions for dnsmasq")
Change-Id: I2f839e473267a25c8fd51a0389510485f126fc7c

commit_message:
Added service authentication options to LBaaS

By default, LBaaS is configured to authenticate to the local instance
of Keystone running at 127.0.0.1:5000.  In large deployments, it will
likely not be there and it will fail to create anything.

This patch adds the options to allow controlling these options in order
to be able to successfully create load balancers.

Change-Id: I76c941235b0177ec5dffe100b0866fab9045f209

Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I8c1652b5758fcc881a32f507b51f8569561e677d

commit_message:
Fixing magnum client floating-ip-enabled switch

As per current implementation, during cluster-template-create
operation it is not possible to set 'False' value to
'floating-ip-enabled' command line switch. This change fixes
the issue. Please refer to bug report #1678287 for more
details.

Change-Id: I9f35d0f095ee7bd2e207a7a7472e3eb6e8799a0e
Closes-Bug: #1678287

commit_message:
Magnum client changes to support verify CA

This change add support to specify 'verify-ca' switch
during the cluster-template-create operation. The
default value is set to True. Certification authority
verification can be disabled by setting 'verify-ca'
switch to False during the cluster template create.

Change-Id: I18ff0298eddfde64dadd0d098ad1bccdba3b2874
Closes-Bug: #1663757

[FWaaS] Migrate 'public' attribute to 'shared'

This patch is the first in the series of patches which tracks the
migration of 'public' attribute to 'shared' in FWaaS v2.

commit_message:
TLS-everywhere: Explicitly set overcloud_domain_name

This used to rely in the undercloud being clever and assuming the domain
from the undercloud. However, this caused issues for some folks. So
instead we do it explicitly.

Change-Id: I3c1a36fa70e46721bbe21826254171cb0166c87c

[{'created': '2017-01-15 01:46:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding zero downtime upgrades gates for cinder

There is need to test cinder services in environments wherein an old & new
version of each service needs to be run concurrently. This is mandatory to
get the assert:supports-zero-downtime-upgrade tag for cinder.

Hence, there is a need to test services in below four combinations.

primary: c-api

subnode: c-bak

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-01-18 17:01:47.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Adding zero downtime upgrades gates for cinder

commit_message:
Adding zero downtime upgrades gates for cinder

There is need to test cinder services in environments wherein an old & new
version of each service needs to be run concurrently. This is mandatory to
get the assert:supports-zero-downtime-upgrade tag for cinder.

Hence, there is a need to test c-api in the below fashion.

primary: c-api
subnode: c-api c-sch c-vol c-bak

Change-Id: Ibf9ab9dc20bba60f94f381674c4e4ac05bca2f6f
Depends-On: I0a65ec2c750aed9ab1b1b83ebfe93e948a525b68

commit_message:
Add libvirtd, libvirtd-guests.service dependencies

To guarantee pollster registration after libvirtd, systemd
dependency rule has to be added. Unless ceilometer-compute agent
will fail to start and just stops with exception below.

    ExtensionLoadError: Failed to connect socket to
    '/var/run/libvirt/libvirt-sock-ro': No such file or directory

Change-Id: Iebaed8763854d86db4a327114c4057363a7b7a74
Signed-off-by: JunHeon <jheon.hwang@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

[{'created': '2017-06-02 12:07:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'deepcopy binding and binding levels avoid expiration

Perform a deepcopy on the sqla objects passed into the PortContext
so we get detached versions of them safe to reference forever.
This is necessary because the PortContexts outlive the
transaction context managers they are creating in which means an
object can be expired and result in a query after a commit
(e.g. in bind_port_if_needed) that will fail and result in an
exception.

This required a few additional explicit session.merge calls to deal
with cases where touching the mech context was implicitly expected
to modify the DB state on the next commit.

	neutron/plugins/ml2/driver_context.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py

commit_message:
deepcopy binding and binding levels avoid expiration

Perform a deepcopy on the sqla objects passed into the PortContext
so we get detached versions of them safe to reference forever.
This is necessary because the PortContexts outlive the
transaction context managers they are creating in which means an
object can be expired and result in a query after a commit
(e.g. in bind_port_if_needed) that will fail and result in an
exception.

This required a few additional explicit session.merge calls to deal
with cases where touching the mech context was implicitly expected
to modify the DB state on the next commit.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/driver_context.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py

Closes-Bug: #1669528
Change-Id: Ib5ba2daa80acba53c082bade1f61a3ee44ca41fc
(cherry picked from commit fc563eaabec392281be90bd2472bed4f6506cb40)

commit_message:
anchor redirects for old guides

We need to anchor the redirects for the old guides at the root of the
server so that the translated versions are still accessible. Otherwise
/ja/ops-guide/ redirects to the latest admin guide in English, for
example.

Change-Id: I85a06e00b04af09bfc1c91592dcedeb2a1fb4e59
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Allow dropdowns to be in front of div.modal-footer

This removes some oddities with the CSS causing select menus to be
hidden in some circumstances. The side effect of this is that when the
modal body is tall, the window now scrolls instead of the body. I'm not
sure if this is actually bad, but its different.

Change-Id: If890ada4c1c450962789db23e9b4cfc50fe77900
Closes-Bug: 1603496
(cherry picked from commit f40e9d438eb759d43e76e837d042740d89d622d8)

commit_message:
Switch to use stable data_utils

Tempest provides stable library interfaces under tempest.lib.
This patch switches to use it for data_utils.

NOTE: Maybe reviewers will feel deja-vu because the similar patch is
      merged before. But ater that, the another copying tempest patch
      has been merged and we need this patch again. Sorry for this mess.
      Iba05bc604f447f2acaf4cd81e05443b366b821a1 will be merged after
      all projects are ready.

Change-Id: I1a39fc0636a3d1b45aed7a283587460afc076110
(cherry picked from commit 2d85dd99d71e9e2678d809b4d89ff17758a6f911)

commit_message:
Switch to use stable data_utils

Tempest provides stable library interfaces under tempest.lib.
This patch switches to use it for data_utils.

NOTE: Maybe reviewers will feel deja-vu because the similar patch is
      merged before. But ater that, the another copying tempest patch
      has been merged and we need this patch again. Sorry for this mess.
      Iba05bc604f447f2acaf4cd81e05443b366b821a1 will be merged after
      all projects are ready.

Change-Id: I1a39fc0636a3d1b45aed7a283587460afc076110
(cherry picked from commit 2d85dd99d71e9e2678d809b4d89ff17758a6f911)

commit_message:
Update Horizon & D_O_A jobs

This patch updates the jobs to run the appropriate Django versions.
There is some confusion here because of py27 installing Django 1.8 for
Newton and Ocata, and Django 1.11 for Pike. The aim is to have
Django 1.8, 1.9 and 1.10 for Newton / Ocata and Django 1.8, 1.9, 1.10
and 1.11 for Pike.

Change-Id: I90452cff669add8191ca1dd6f6688e26540e9aa4

subject: jenkins: openstack-ansible: Add openSUSE 42.3 jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-24 12:56:43.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "jenkins: openstack-ansible: Add openSUSE 42.3 jobs

openSUSE 42.3 is being released soon but we are already building images
for it so add it as a non-voting job to the OpenStack Ansible roles.
However, we don't add it to the AIO project yet as that still doesn't
work properly on 42.2 so it's pointless to add 42.3 at this point.

Change-Id: I9a5ec74eca996733ac97cca284f8e20f6886ee13
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
jenkins: openstack-ansible: Add openSUSE 42.3 jobs

openSUSE 42.3 is being released soon but we are already building images
for it so add it as a non-voting job to the OpenStack Ansible roles.
However, we don't add it to the AIO project yet as that still doesn't
work properly on 42.2 so it's pointless to add 42.3 at this point.

Change-Id: I9a5ec74eca996733ac97cca284f8e20f6886ee13

subject: Temporarily disable voting on non-rabbit oslo.messaging jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-27 17:05:47.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Temporarily disable voting on non-rabbit oslo.messaging jobs

The non-rabbitmq drivers do not have virtual host support.  This is
causing various compute tests to fail.  Temporarily turn off voting
for these jobs until the virtual host problem is fixed.

Change-Id: Ie87b0fb923b093d1a1943686bccd33133e1d3d2e
Related-Bug: #1706987
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Temporarily disable voting on non-rabbit oslo.messaging jobs

The non-rabbitmq drivers do not have virtual host support.  This is
causing various compute tests to fail.  Temporarily turn off voting
for these jobs until the virtual host problem is fixed.

Change-Id: Ie87b0fb923b093d1a1943686bccd33133e1d3d2e
Related-Bug: #1706987

revisions:

It's no longer necessary because the v2 plugin is going to be
removed, which is likely before the completion of the lib/neutron
transition, which this job is for.  The transition is taking

commit_message:
networking-midonet: Remove v2-full-legacy experimental job

It's no longer necessary because the v2 plugin is going to be
removed, which is likely before the completion of the lib/neutron
transition, which this job is for.  The transition is taking
far longer than I expected when I created this job.

Change-Id: I08e2160ddfff13d3940fea0afacb1ab475e427fc

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 01:21:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix swift enable/disable logic in rally-dsmv-* jobs

Change-Id: I787bdc5f83efc96237dfcdaa0fa7a909baba8956
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-28 07:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/rally.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix swift enable/disable logic in rally-dsmv-* jobs

Desire state is that all rally-dsvm jobs, except py35,
are deploying Swfit. Perviously we have wrong logic for disabling
Swift (it was disable only when it was enabled).

Now we are fixing the behaviour and configurution of all jobs, so jobs
would be configured properly.

Change-Id: I787bdc5f83efc96237dfcdaa0fa7a909baba8956
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix swift enable/disable logic in rally-dsmv-* jobs

Desire state is that all rally-dsvm jobs, except py35,
are deploying Swfit. Perviously we have wrong logic for disabling
Swift (it was disable only when it was enabled).

Now we are fixing the behaviour and configurution of all jobs, so jobs
would be configured properly.

Change-Id: I787bdc5f83efc96237dfcdaa0fa7a909baba8956

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should use that function to generate uuids for consistency.

Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Add additional test case for Action

Currently , although action doesnt accept Non Text values
due to the common converter in neutron-lib, however, there
are no tests for action. The following patch adds a test for
the action attribute.
TrivialFix

Depends-On: I6faf26d263788d21da078e570487ee4876d04efd
Change-Id: I9a1b222189d35c22ef6421abd188272f2c0cfc6c

subject: Simplify get Lifecycle Controller version
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. Pioso', 'email': 'richard.pioso@dell.com', 'username': 'richard.pioso'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-25 22:53:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Simplify get Lifecycle Controller version

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", describes how to determine the Lifecycle
Controller version. See section 31.4, "Check Version of Lifecycle
Controller (LC)". It simply enumerates the DCIM_SystemView class. No
filter query is used to limit the items returned. And notably, that use
case does not require the LC remote service to be in a "ready" state.

That use case is implemented by the 
dracclient.resource.lifecycle_controller.LifecycleControllerManagement.get_version()
method. It has used a filter query and waited for the integrated Dell
Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) to be ready. To align it with best
practices, this patch eliminates its use of a filter query and wait for
the iDRAC.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

Change-Id: I9a499522b59f18282fc9a57227570f54e46dfd3e
Closes-Bug: #1697558
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-27 14:39:58.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/tests/test_lifecycle_controller.py', 'dracclient/resources/lifecycle_controller.py'], 'message': 'Simplify get Lifecycle Controller version

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", describes how to determine the Lifecycle
Controller version. See section 31.4, "Check Version of Lifecycle
Controller (LC)". It simply enumerates the DCIM_SystemView class. No
filter query is used to limit the items returned. And notably, that use
case does not require the LC remote service to be in a "ready" state.

That use case is implemented by the
dracclient.resource.lifecycle_controller.LifecycleControllerManagement.get_version()
method. It has used a filter query and waited for the integrated Dell
Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) to be ready. To align it with best
practices, this patch eliminates its use of a filter query and wait for
the iDRAC.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

Change-Id: I9a499522b59f18282fc9a57227570f54e46dfd3e
Closes-Bug: #1697558
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Simplify get Lifecycle Controller version

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", describes how to determine the Lifecycle
Controller version. See section 31.4, "Check Version of Lifecycle
Controller (LC)". It simply enumerates the DCIM_SystemView class. No
filter query is used to limit the items returned. And notably, that use
case does not require the LC remote service to be in a "ready" state.

That use case is implemented by the
dracclient.resource.lifecycle_controller.LifecycleControllerManagement.get_version()
method. It has used a filter query and waited for the integrated Dell
Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) to be ready. To align it with best
practices, this patch eliminates its use of a filter query and wait for
the iDRAC.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

Change-Id: I9a499522b59f18282fc9a57227570f54e46dfd3e
Closes-Bug: #1697558

subject: Enumerate operations can wait until iDRAC is ready
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. Pioso', 'email': 'richard.pioso@dell.com', 'username': 'richard.pioso'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-30 22:48:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enumerate operations can wait until iDRAC is ready

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) Enumerate operations
can fail or return invalid results when issued to an Integrated Dell
Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) whose Lifecycle Controller remote
service is not "ready". The following are examples of failures which
have been observed:

+ The result of Enumerate is an error.
+ Enumerate succeeds, but no items are returned when they are known to
exist.
+ Enumerate succeeds, but items for all those known to exist are not
returned.

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
those supported by the openstack/python-dracclient project. A notable
exception is the get version of the Lifecycle Controller use case. It is
implemented by the
dracclient.resource.lifecycle_controller.LifecycleControllerManagement.get_version()
method.

This patch defines a new method in class dracclient.client.WSManClient,
enumerate(). It extends the base class's implementation by adding a new
parameter that indicates whether the iDRAC must be ready to accept the
Enumerate command. When it must by ready, that method waits until the
iDRAC is ready before issuing the command. Since almost all Enumerate
operations require the iDRAC to be ready, the new parameter's default
value is 'True'.

Additionally, the get_version() method mentioned above has been changed
to not use a filter query, because the white paper's description of that
use case does not.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

commit_message:
Enumerate operations can wait until iDRAC is ready

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) Enumerate operations
can fail or return invalid results when issued to an integrated Dell
Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) whose Lifecycle Controller remote
service is not "ready". The following are examples of failures which
have been observed:

+ The result of Enumerate is an error.
+ Enumerate succeeds, but no items are returned when they are known to
exist.
+ Enumerate succeeds, but items for all those known to exist are not
returned.

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
supported by this project, openstack/python-dracclient.

This patch defines a new method in class dracclient.client.WSManClient,
enumerate(). It extends its base class's implementation by adding a new
parameter that indicates whether or not it should wait until the iDRAC
is ready to accept commands before issuing the Enumerate command. When
it is true, that method waits until the iDRAC is ready before issuing
the command. Since almost all Enumerate operations require the iDRAC to
be ready, the new parameter's default value is 'True'.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

Change-Id: Ied659a4ee45b1dd55cd3a420301d866d52c838fb
Partial-Bug: #1697558
Related-Bug: #1691808

[{'created': '2017-06-30 22:48:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Invoke operations can wait until iDRAC is ready

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) Invoke operations can
fail when issued to an Integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC)
whose Lifecycle Controller remote service is not "ready".

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
those supported by the openstack/python-dracclient project. A notable
exception is the dracclient.client.WSManClient.is_idrac_ready() method,
which is a chicken and egg situation.

This patch adds a new parameter to the
dracclient.client.WSManClient.invoke() method that indicates whether the
iDRAC must be ready to accept the Invoke command. When it must be ready,
that method waits until the iDRAC is ready before issuing the command.
Since almost all Invoke operations require the iDRAC to be ready, the
new parameter's default value is 'True'.

commit_message:
Invoke operations can wait until iDRAC is ready

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) Invoke operations can
fail when issued to an integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC)
whose Lifecycle Controller remote service is not "ready".

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
supported by this project, openstack/python-dracclient. A notable
exception is the dracclient.client.WSManClient.is_idrac_ready() method,
which is a chicken and egg situation.

This patch adds a new parameter to the
dracclient.client.WSManClient.invoke() method that indicates whether or
not it should wait until the iDRAC is ready to accept commands before
issuing the Invoke command. When it is true, that method waits until the
iDRAC is ready before issuing the command. Since almost all Invoke
operations require the iDRAC to be ready, the new parameter's default
value is 'True'.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-11 01:32:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Parameterize iDRAC is ready retries at class level

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) requests/commands can
fail or return invalid results when issued to an Integrated Dell Remote
Access Controller (iDRAC) whose Lifecycle Controller remote service is
not "ready". Specifically, that applies to the WS-Man Enumerate and
Invoke operations.

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
supported by this project, openstack/python-dracclient. That document
describes how to determine the readiness of the Lifecycle Controller
remote service.

This patch parameterizes the iDRAC is ready retry behavior at the class
level. That makes it possible for consumers of this project, such as
project openstack/ironic, to configure it library API-wide.

Additionally, this patch improves the names of the parameters to class
__init__() methods that control the retry behavior on SSL errors, so
that they are not confused with those added by this patch. Finally, it
defines constants for the default values of the iDRAC is ready retry
parameters, and utilizes those new constants.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

commit_message:
Parameterize iDRAC is ready retries at class level

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) requests/commands can
fail or return invalid results when issued to an integrated Dell Remote
Access Controller (iDRAC) whose Lifecycle Controller remote service is
not "ready". Specifically, that applies to the WS-Man Enumerate and
Invoke operations.

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
supported by this project, openstack/python-dracclient. That document
describes how to determine the readiness of the Lifecycle Controller
remote service.

This patch parameterizes the iDRAC is ready retry behavior at the class
level. That makes it possible for consumers of this project, such as
project openstack/ironic, to configure it library API-wide.

Additionally, this patch improves the names of the parameters to class
__init__() methods that control the retry behavior on SSL errors, so
that they are not confused with those added by this patch. Finally, it
defines constants for the default values of the retry behavior on SSL
errors and iDRAC is ready retry parameters, and utilizes those new
constants.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332

commit_message:
Declare plainly the current state of PostgreSQL in OpenStack

This declares the current state of OpenStack's database support
explaining the impact of perceived support of PostgreSQL.

It advises concrete steps to take in order to avoid a false
impression of having a sustaining PostgreSQL support available.

Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>

Change-Id: I332cef8ec4539520adcf37c6d2ea11488289fcfd

commit_message:
use synchronized decorator from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the synchronized lock decorator and neutron is
removing it's implementation I729da348e340509f2d09f8a6436716e2398f1583

This patch uses the decorator from neutron-lib rather than neutron.

Change-Id: Iaf2ce2e339471c91fa64047942c0bb385dd224ee

Octavia completed this work as part of our new API endpoint in Pike.
This patch provides the links to the final patch in the chain implementing
the goal and the associated documentation.

[{'created': '2017-07-28 07:21:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update node fialed

Update node fialed via dashboard.
The mesg: There was an error submitting the form. Please try again.
The detailed message of failure : Exception Value: 'cluster_id'.
Refer to url : https://docs.openstack.org/senlin/latest/user/nodes.html#updating-a-node.
At least now we know that we can update name, profile, role and metadata of node ,
but can not update cluster that node updated belongs to.
For details, see bug below.

commit_message:
Update node failed

Update node failed via dashboard.
The mesg: There was an error submitting the form. Please try again.
The detailed message of failure : Exception Value: 'cluster_id'.
Refer to url : https://docs.openstack.org/senlin/latest/user/nodes.html#updating-a-node.
At least now we know that we can update name, profile, role and metadata of node ,
but can not update cluster that node updated belongs to.
For details, see bug below.

Change-Id: Ie871a59cc6a6533e35b1e8828cd980c68d33eae1
Closes-Bug: #1707120

commit_message:
Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: I553460a231ee27b63220c1540b39fd213e79e032

commit_message:
The parameter "fields" is lack in call to self._make_bgp_peer_dict.

If "fields" vaule is not "None" in the function
"get_bgp_peers_by_bgp_speaker", this value should
be put into the called function "self._make_bgp_peer_dict(x)".

Change-Id: Icfb50a4ae59f3008c81bd39bd16c8827841b33d7

commit_message:
Fix potential transient switching loop in br-int

Avoid setting up default table in integration bridge before
the physical bridges are setup to drop traffic. This avoids
potential switching loops.

Closes-Bug: #1682805
Change-Id: I8853ba5ad1c795de22de1e419598f138636d220b

commit_message:
Remove obsolete cache_data from Stack

This is no longer required as the convergence 'lightweight stack' used for
checking individual resources has now merged with the other code paths: in
every case intrinsic functions are resolved using the data about resources
stored in StackDefinition and accessed via ResourceProxy.

Change-Id: I41cf21c8e1babe819b4b6c668749ed5915ae3b54

subject: Enable some off-by-default checks
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-22 01:44:04.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: Iadb49e002b788793c2b9ef5605f247fe8e47eb2f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: Iadb49e002b788793c2b9ef5605f247fe8e47eb2f

commit_message:
fix alignment of toc tree items in sidebar

The global toctree showing the document structure uses a different
HTML mix than the in-page toctree, so we have to express the padding
differently.

Change-Id: Iee79924d893180c8233a6b345f9f2143a7840324
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Refactor project tree

Old project tree had everything mixed up
in different locations. Not to mention
that actual REST controllers resided in
package that's name did not reflect the content.

Reorganized the tree to be more predictable
and easier to maintain.

Change-Id: Ic9acc80a4cf7416394702d43141c96953c03beea
